thread.section_title: Stock Market & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Brazil’s Real Continues Slump

author: Jeffrey T. Lewis
title: Brazil’s Real Continues Slump
text:
SÃO PAULO—The Brazilian real weakened past 3.98 to the dollar Monday morning, the first time it reached that level since 2002.
The real was trading at 3.9798 to the dollar at 10:02 a.m. local time, according to Tullett Prebon via FactSet, after reaching 3.9830 earlier in the session. The real exited active trading at 3.9480 on Friday, its second-lowest close ever, then weakened further in after-hours trading.
The Brazilian...
